description.excerpt:
This repository contains the resources necessary to populate and curate the model catalog. The repository is organized as follows (see respective readme files in subfolders to know more about each of their contents):
 * AutomaticLayoutDetection: Script that given a layout file extracted automatically from a dataset, it transforms it into the DataCubes representation from W3C. 
 * CSVToRDF: Scripts to transform all model contents in /Data to RDF.
 * Data: All CSV files containing information of the models, their metadata and variables. The data is organized so the columns represent properties and data properties of the ontology, while the rows are instances described and linked in the models (e.g., input types, variables, etc.)
 * ExportCatalog: Scripts to extract the contents of the model catalogs as a series of CSVs.
 * GSNVariableImport: Scripts that query the current contents of the model catalog to extract GSNs (now SVOs) and bring the appropriate context into the model catalog. Additional links to Wikidata are created in the process. 
 * OtherTransformations: Legacy scripts to organize information about units.
 * UnitToRDF: Scripts designed to align unit labels provided by modelers (e.g., "m/day") to a semantic representation.
A repository containing the resources needed to create a catalog of software model models and link them together

excerpt.name: Model Catalog 1.7.0: Updated SVO URIs
excerpt.body:
This release of the model catalog assigns SVOs identifiers to local URIs (of type https://w3id.org/okn/o/sd#StandardVariable). 
Thanks to this change, the local API will have less trouble distinguishing ids. In addition, when a new SVO is created, we don't need to have a mechanism dependent on SVO.

All ids that correspond to an SVO are preserved with an owl:sameAs. Some of the descriptions from existing SVOs are also imported for consistency

excerpt.name: Model Catalog 1.6.0: Updated ontology
excerpt.body:
This release uses version 1.8.0 of the Software description ontology and version 1.7.0 of the software description ontology for models. Below are the most relevant changes. The migration has occurred only for the mint graph so far:
- Fixed errors in data and cleaned up some incorrect instances.
- used hasBuildFile to point to the docker file of a few model configurations
- used data transformation link (isTransformedFrom property) (one example done)
- added parameters that are catalog ids as such.
- Tagged all setups that have executions as non-editable
- Added model categories as instances of class
- Added new type of model: CoupledModel .

excerpt.name: Model Catalog 1.5.0: Fixed descriptions and new model setups
excerpt.body:
This version of the model catalog includes:
* New changes for indicators and indices (better descriptions)
* Polished data descriptions for models
* New model export to freeze catalog contents
* Improved uploading process when new changes to the ontology are required.

excerpt.name: Model Catalog 1.4.1: Added export functionality
excerpt.body: This version of the model catalog incorporates export scripts to extract all the triples, inspect them and update them with changes if necessary. It also fixes some labels in TopoFlow, and adds processes to the model.

excerpt.name: Model Catalog 1.4.0: Added definitions for Indices
excerpt.body: This version of the model catalog defines better indices. Now indices have a label, description and a pointer to the SVO that corresponds (if available)

excerpt.name: Model Catalog 1.3.0: Small changes and bug fixes
excerpt.body:
This version of he model catalog introduces small changes in the ontology:
 * Country now is partOf (so regions can be part of regions).
 * New property for tagging releases.
 * New property for defining increments (useful for ensembles)
 * Fix #34 and #35

excerpt.name: Model Catalog 1.1.0: New contents and updates
excerpt.body:
This release of the model catalog includes:
 * New setups for several regions for TopoFlow, HAND, PIHM.
 * Models now include a postprocessing step that will create visualizations and images.
 * Removed old deprecated versions of some models (kept the old PIHM version for now)

excerpt.name: Model Catalog v1.0.0: Initial release
excerpt.body:
This release of the model catalog includes:
 * Descriptions for the hydrology, economic, agricultural and climate models included in MINT, including their metadata and variables.
 * Link of all variables to SVO. Variables defined in SVO are brought in with their context (i.e., objects and properties they describe).
 * Semantic description of units. Each unit is describes according to the NASA QUDT standard.
 * Links to Wikidata. Variables and units are linked to Wikidata for additional descriptions and as a point of reference
 * Initial work towards transforming the layout of files as data cubes. 

Endpoint ready in: https://endpoint.mint.isi.edu/dataset.html?tab=query&ds=/ds
